CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Child to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Parent: Child, I have a new project that I've been working on.
Child: What is it, Parent?
Parent: I created a website where I post advertisements, and people can pay to see them.
Child: Oh, that's interesting. How does it work?
Parent: Well, I create the ads myself, and then I post them on my website. People who want to view the ads can pay a small fee, and then they can see them.
Child: Do you think people will pay to see your ads?
Parent: I don't know yet, but I hope so. I've put a lot of effort into creating some eye-catching ads.
Child: That sounds cool, but why do you want to make money from ads?
Parent: Well, I want to have some extra income coming in. Plus, I enjoy being creative and making things, so this is a great way for me to combine those passions.
Child: I see. Well, I hope it works out for you, Parent.
Parent: Thanks, Child. And who knows, maybe someday you can help me create some ads for the website.
Child: Sure, that sounds like fun! Speaking of creativity, remember that time we made those homemade decorations together?
Parent: Yes, I do remember that. That was a fun afternoon. 

MEMORY 1:
The Parent expresses a desire to be a better role model for the Child and their siblings. This leads to the Child being caring and offering help to the Parent. 
The Child feels it is unfair that they have to do certain chores because the Parent is too tired. This leads to the Parent acknowledging being lazy about washing dishes and promising to contribute more to keeping the home clean. They have open communication about various topics, including a past accident and the parent's willingness to contribute more to household chores. This leads to the Parent seeing a doctor and taking medicine for their illness.
